official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should seek a six-month moratorium with the Soviet Union on the testing of nuclear warheads in order to negotiate a mutual and verifiable comprehensive nuclear test ban treaty.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should: (1) immediately seek a six-month verifiable moratorium with the Soviet Union on the testing of nuclear devices; (2) utilize such moratorium to negotiate a verifiable comprehensive nuclear test ban with the Soviet Union; and (3) request the advice and consent of the Senate to the ratification of the Threshold Test Ban Treaty of 1974 and the Peaceful Nuclear Explosions Treaty of 1976.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should seek a six-month moratorium with the Soviet Union on the testing of nuclear warheads in order to negotiate a mutual and verifiable comprehensive nuclear test ban treaty.
